text:
Q: Anonymous delegate vs Event handler for getting data from data thread to GUI thread A:

The IProgress<in T> looks like it would be the right choice if writing the part that is in the third party library. However in this example the 3rd party library isn't doing that. The library method call spins off a thread then returns and eventually the JobDoneEvent triggers. I should make that more clear in the question.

Q: Snowflake Clustering Depth A:

The function you are using is telling you how clustered the table currently is based on the columns that you are providing. It is not telling you how clustered the table would be if you actually clustered it by that column. If the table itself is not clustered by anything, and if you are unsure which key is best to cluster by, you may want to consider creating a materialized view for each cluster key you want to test. Snowflake will determine whether it is best to use the table or materialized view based on the query (assuming the query always references the table). This will cost you on storage and clustering, but after it is setup, you can take a look at query executions and determine which MV is leveraged most frequently and then cluster your table in that way...and drop the MVs...or if it is giving you the performance you want for the cost, just leave it.

Q: npm: Could not determine Node.js install directory A:

I just had a similar issue.

I managed to use npm after installing NodeJs using Windows Powershell, based on this GitHub discussion...

https://github.com/coreybutler/nvm-windows/issues/527

Q: How can I read my app's database file from device? A:

You can view (visualize) the data in the .db file by using the software called "DB Browser for SQLITE"

  1. get your .db file from the device(smartphone) memory (by accessing the DDMS --> File explore)
  2. download and install sqlitebrowser (http://sqlitebrowser.org/)
  3. after installing, open "DB Browser for SQLITE" and go to "open database" to load your .db file
  4. Choose the "Browse data" tab
  5. Finally, select the table you want to visualize to display the data in the database.

Q: SSIS error loading package in VS 2012 with TFS A:

I resolved a very similar situation by changing the TargetServerVersion in the project general configuration properties. I use Visual Studio 2015. By default SQL Server vNext was selected, whereas I have SQL Server 2012 installed.

Q: Setting IGMP Version on Windows 7 A:

As far as I remember, adding IGMPVersion=3 to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters is the only way to solve your problem.

Anyway, there is another creepy solution - just write a little daemon, that will sniff for IGMPv3, parse data from it and send IGMPv2 packets =)
